bioghist.p: Dr. Kenneth M. Macur became Medaille College’s seventh President on June 1, 2015. He has a B.S. in Accountancy, an MBA in Finance and a Ph.D. in Accountancy, all from the University of Illinois at Urbana/Champaign. In addition, he is a licensed CPA (Wisconsin). Dr. Macur previously served as Provost and Dean of Bethany College (KS) and Associate Vice President for Academic Affairs and Online Learning at Edgewood College (Madison, WI). He was a tenured full professor in Accounting and Information Systems at Edgewood College and at the University of Wisconsin – Whitewater.

Dr. Richard T. Jurasek, Ph.D. was employed at Medaille College in the position of the President between June 2007 and June 2015. He was previously the executive vice president of Antioch College in Yellow Springs, Ohio. At Antioch College, Dr. Jurasek served as the chief operations officer with direct responsibility for admissions, financial aid, academic affairs, student affairs and auxiliary services. Dr. Jurasek originally joined Antioch in 2003 as the college's vice president and dean of faculty. He served as the Antioch's interim president from July 2004-February 2006 and was promoted to executive vice president in March 2006. Before joining Antioch College, Dr. Jurasek served as the dean of faculty at Augustana College in Rock Island, and as Professor of German at Earlham College in Richmond. Dr. Jurasek earned both his Ph.D. and master's degrees in German from The Ohio State University and his bachelor's degree in German from Ohio University.
Makur's Mark Newsletter written by Kenneth Macur and donated by Chad Taylor.
